metadata.title: Map of the North-West Territory of the Province of Canada from actual survey during the years 1792 to 1812 .

snippets.text:
This Map made for the North West Company in 1813 and 1814 and delivered to
The Honourable William M. Gilmore, then Agent. Embraces the Region
lying between 45 and 60 degrees North Latitude and 95 and 120 degrees
West Longitude comprising the Surveys and Discoveries of 20 years namely:
the Discovery and Survey of the Oregon Territory to the Pacific Ocean,
the survey of the Athabasca Lake, Slave River and Lake, from which
flows Mackenzie River to the Arctic Ocean by Mr. Simpson, the Route of Sir
Alexander Mackenzie in 1782 down part of Peace River
together with the Survey of this River to the
Pacific Ocean by the late John Stuart
of the North West Company
by David Thompson
Astronomer and Surveyor

[Signature]

David Thompson
